# EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Copper plate mine at position(x=41.0, y=-82.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Burner mining drill (position x=41.0, y=-82.0) and a stone-furnace at position(x=41.0, y=-80.0)
-  Burner mining drill (no other drill found) 

### Copper plate mine at position(x=60.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Stone-furnace (position x=60.0, y=-60.0) 

### Electricity generator at position(x=106.5, y=-32.5)
Consists of following entities
-  Offshore pump (position x=106.5, y=-32.5)
-  Boiler (position x=111.5, y=-32.0)
-  Steam engine (position x=117.5, y=-30.5)
-  Pipe group (position x=107.5, y=-34.5)
-  Pipe group (position x=105.5, y=-32.5)

### Transport belt at position(x=63.5, y=-53.5)
Consists of following entities
-  Transport belt (position x=63.5, y=-53.5)
-  Transport belt (position x=64.5, y=-53.5)

### Belt group at position(x=40.5, y=-83.5)
Consists of following entities
-  Belt group (position x=40.5, y=-83.5)

# ERROR TIPS
### Errors when using burner entities without fuel
-  Make sure to provide fuel to burner entities before using them.
### Errors when using stone furnaces without ingredients
-  Ensure that stone furnaces have the necessary ingredients to operate.
### Errors when using offshore pumps without connection to boiler
-  Connect offshore pumps to boilers to ensure proper operation.
### Errors when using steam engines without connection to electricity network
-  Connect steam engines to the electricity network to ensure proper operation.
### Errors when using transport belts without items to transport
-  Ensure that transport belts have items to transport to function correctly.
### Errors when using belt groups without connection to other entities
-  Connect belt groups to other entities, such as transport belts or furnaces, to ensure proper operation.
### Errors when using entities without proper positioning
-  Ensure that entities are properly positioned to function correctly and avoid collisions.

# NAMESPACE
No utility functions or variables have been defined or invoked in the given execution logs.
